article.headline: San Diego State 81, UNLV 73
article.story: LAS VEGAS (AP) -- Brandon Heath had a career-high 37 points and Marcus Slaughter added 17 Saturday night to lead San Diego State to an 81-73 win against UNLV. Heath had 23 of his points in the second-half as the Aztecs (8-7, 2-0 Mountain West Conference) built a 12-point lead. Chris Manker added 13 points. San Diego State has won two straight road games to begin the conference season undefeated, and has won three straight overall. UNLV (7-7, 0-2) pulled within three, 61-58, with 9:18 to play after a 10-0 run that was sparked by a pair of 3-pointers from Michael Umeh. But San Diego State was never rattled and Heath was perfect on 11 attempts from the free-throw line down the stretch. Manker hit a trio of 3-pointers in a span of 2:40 midway through the first half, helping San Diego State erase an early six point deficit. Chris Walton connected on a 3-pointer to cap a 13-4 run and give the Aztecs the advantage for good, 36-27 with 4:36 to play in the first half. Umeh lead UNLV with 18 points. Romel Beck had 16 points and Odartey Blankson had 14.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).
